page.title: 01Two Banks of River Dee
page.content: The River Dee twists and bends through this areaproviding a number of fishing pools. The main road, the North Deeside Road is busy with tourists particularly for skiing in the winter and when the Queen is in residence at Balmoral to the west of this area. The hills rise sharply beside the road with coniferous trees giving way to barer hills. The summit of Geallaig Hill (white hill) is just to the north of the area. Some land has been brought under cultivation on this side ad farming is the main source of employment. The South Deeside road is narrower and more winding. This is in Abergeldie estate and Abergeldie Castle stands close to the Dee at the South Western corner. The preent laird lives here and is a working farmer. There are few houses on this side of the river.
